description: "Natural" logarithm, defined inductively by a(1)=1, a(p)=1+a(p-1) if p is prime and a(n*m)=a(n)+a(m) if n, m>1.
comments: Related to A005245, the complexity of n, which is <= this sequence. They are equal up to term a(46) and for 771 values out of the first 1000 terms. A061373 is easier to compute.a(A182061(n)) = n and a(m) < n for m < A182061(n). [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 09 2012]
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
J. Arias de Reyna, Complejidad de los numeros naturales, Gaceta de la Real Sociedad Matematica Espanola, 3, (2000), 230-250. (In Spanish.)
mathematica: a[1]=1; a[p_?PrimeQ] := 1+a[p-1]; a[n_] := a[n] = With[{d=Divisors[n][[2]] }, a[d] + a[n/d]]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Feb 26 2016 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (genericIndex)a061373 1 = 1a061373 n = genericIndex a061373_list (n-1)a061373_list = 1 : f 2 where   f x | x == spf  = 1 + a061373 (spf - 1) : f (x + 1)       | otherwise = a061373 spf + a061373 (x `div` spf) : f (x + 1)       where spf = a020639 x-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 09 2012
author: _Juan Arias-de-Reyna_, Jun 08 2001
